job description:
The Chan Zuckerberg Biohub (the "CZ Biohub”) is a well-funded, non-profit, life science research institute located in the Mission Bay neighborhood of San Francisco, California. We are committed to solving some of the world’s biggest problems together: we seek to help cure, prevent or manage all human diseases by the end of the century. We find and invest in the best and brightest scientists and engineers and we seek to create an environment of true and free-flowing collaboration. We provide the best technologies and tools available – and when they don’t exist yet, we build them.

WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE DO:

The Pollard lab is developing statistical models and bioinformatics tools to study the human microbiome using metagenomic sequencing data. We are characterizing genetic variation in human-associated microbes and using this knowledge to track microbiome strains and functions as the microbes evolve.

We are seeking a Bioinformatician to join our exceptional, motivated, and highly collaborative team. This position focuses on analyzing metagenomic data, including developing open source software and datasets. The ability to develop, evaluate and implement new bioinformatics pipelines in collaboration with other team members will be critical.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:

• Analyze metagenomics datasets from public sources as well as datasets generated through internal and external collaborations. Quantify taxa, genes, and genetic variants across samples.

• Evaluate and improve open source software tools for metagenomics data analysis.

• Develop and maintain curated data resources for the Pollard lab, collaborators, and potentially for public distribution.

Requirements

• PhD degree in Statistics, Bioinformatics, Computer Science, Genomics, or a related field, with at least 5 years of hands-on experience with Bioinformatics methods.

• Expertise in programming languages commonly used in Bioinformatics (such as Python and R).

• Familiarity with NGS algorithms, such as Bowtie, BLAST, PLINK, etc.

• Fluency with Linux shell scripting and high-performance computing.

• Experience fitting, comparing, and interpreting statistical models.

• Passion to build innovative software solutions and data analysis pipelines.

• Ability to write and publish articles in quality peer-reviewed journals, and present at internal and external meetings.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

• Prior experience with shotgun metagenomics data preferred.

• Significant experience in algorithm development and implementing pipelines for NGS data analysis

• Knowledge in Amazon cloud computing and Docker is a plus

This opportunity is full-time only. No contractors, consultancies or recruiters will be considered. CZ Biohub is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
